column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Hajj
#Text=The traditional annual Muslim pilgrimage to Mecca , the Hajj is a mandatory religious duty for Muslims and is the largest annual gathering of people in the world .
#Text=It occurs between the 8th and 12th of the last month of the Islamic calendar , Dhu al-Hijjah .

#Text=Hajj is that symbolic pilgrimage when millions of Muslims from around the world belonging to different ethnic groups , socioeconomic strata and cultures travel to Mecca together and praise to Allah and ask for forgiveness of their sins .

#Text=The five day spiritual Hajj , which dates back to the 7th century of the Christian calendar , is designed to promote the bonds and affection between Muslim communities and shows that everyone is equal in the eyes of Allah by wearing simple white garment Ihram .
#Text=Pilgrims spend days worshiping in and around the holy city of Mecca and perform rituals that make up the Hajj .
#Text=Understand
#Text=The Hajj is one of the five pillars of Islam ; every adult Muslim is supposed to do it at some time in his or her life if health and finances permit .
#Text=In poorer areas it is not uncommon for whole families or even whole villages to chip in to send one person .
#Text=It is an exceedingly cosmopolitan affair .

#Text=Predominantly Muslim areas include most of North Africa , the Middle East and Central Asia , plus South and Southeast Asian countries such as Pakistan , Bangladesh , Malaysia and Indonesia and several countries in West Africa .
#Text=Several other areas have large Muslim minorities and there are some Muslims nearly everywhere .
#Text=The pilgrimage brings Muslims from all these places together .
#Text=It is also one of the largest human migrations .
#Text=Every year over two million people visit Saudi Arabia for this pilgrimage .
#Text=Since they all arrive at roughly the same time and visit the same places in the same order , and since a large number of Saudis go as well , this is a major logistical problem .
#Text=The Saudi government has a ministry to manage it .
#Text=The Hajj can only be completed during the Islamic month of Dhu al-Hijjah .
#Text=A pilgrimage to Mecca at any other time is known as Umrah ( عمرة ) , and while not compulsory is strongly recommended .
#Text=History
#Text=The early history of Hajj can be traced back to the time of Abraham , around 2000 BCE .
#Text=According to Islamic tradition , Abraham was ordered by Allah to leave his wife Hagar and his son Ishmael alone in the uninhabited desert with little food and water , where Mecca stands today .
#Text=When the food and water were gone , Hagar , in search of water for her baby Ishmael , desperately ran seven times between the two hills of Safa and Marwah but found nothing .
#Text=Returning in despair to Ishmael , she saw him scratching the ground with his leg and a water fountain underneath .
#Text=Later , the uninhabited desert area started to attract inhabitants due to availability of water and tribes started to settle in Mecca .
#Text=When Ishmael grew up , he was married into a tribe in Mecca .
#Text=At some point , Abraham was commanded by Allah to construct a building believed to be the Kaaba , which he did with the help of Ishmael .
#Text=Abraham was commanded by Allah to invite people to perform pilgrimage in Mecca around the Kaaba .
#Text=In pre-Islamic Arabia , Meccans were idol worshippers and the Kaaba was surrounded by pagan idols .
#Text=During the annual pilgrimage season , people would visit the Kaaba to perform rituals some of which were introduced by Arabs of that time .
#Text=It is believed some pilgrims would perform tawaf around Kaaba in a naked state .
#Text=During the initial years of Muhammad 's prophethood , the pilgrimage season offered Muhammad the occasion to preach Islam to the foreign people who came to Mecca for pilgrimage .

#Text=In 630 CE , after Mecca was conquered by Muhammad , he led his followers from Medina to Mecca , cleansed the Kaaba by destroying all the pagan idols , and then reconsecrated the building to Allah .

#Text=In 631 CE , at the direction of Muhammad , Abu Bakr led some 300 Muslims to the pilgrimage in Mecca where Ali delivered a sermon stipulating the new rites of Hajj and abrogating the pagan rites .
#Text=He especially declared that no unbeliever , pagan , or naked man would be allowed to circumambulate the Kaaba from the next year .
#Text=In 632 CE , Muhammad performed his only pilgrimage with a large number of followers , and instructed them on the rites of Hajj and the manners of performing them .
#Text=From then , Hajj became one of the five pillars of Islam .

#Text=In medieval times , pilgrims would gather in the big cities of Syria , Egypt , and Iraq to go to Mecca in groups and caravans comprising tens of thousands of pilgrims , often under state patronage .
#Text=Some Hajj caravans were guarded by soldiers because there were risks of robbery or attack or natural hazards .
#Text=Muslim travelers like Ibn Jubayr and Ibn Battuta have recorded detailed accounts of Hajj travels in medieval times .
#Text=The University of California Berkeley has a good online account of Ibn Battuta 's travels including several visits to Mecca , the first in 1326 CE .
#Text=Despite it being illegal for non-Muslims , a few Western explorers have managed the journey — most notably , Sir Richard Burton made the Hajj in 1853 and wrote an account of the trip .
#Text=Prepare
#Text=Unless you are a citizen of Saudi Arabia you will need a visa , obtained in advance from a Saudi embassy .
#Text=Visas are allocated on a quota system , based on the number of Muslims in a country .
#Text=You may need to provide evidence that you are Muslim , such as a letter from your local mosque .
#Text=Women under 45 are required to travel with a mahram , a related adult male who is the head of her family ( usually a husband or father ) , and proof of the relationship is required .
#Text=Women over 45 may travel without a mahram if they 're in an organized group and each has a letter of permission from the man who would be her mahram .
#Text=Proof of vaccination for meningitis ( specifically the ACYW135 vaccine ) between three years before and ten days before your entry into Saudi Arabia is required .
#Text=Yellow fever vaccination is required if you arrive from any country with known yellow fever infections , and polio vaccinations are required for children up to 15 .

#Text=As millions of people from all over the world gather for Hajj and therefore you will be exposed to many diseases , you may want to discuss other vaccinations and preventative measures with your doctor .
#Text=Throughout Hajj you are expected to remove signs of wealth or class distinctions by replacing your clothing with simple white garments .
#Text=These pieces are called ‘ ihram clothing ’ , and for women comprise of a white abaya , scarf or shawl and socks .
#Text=The ihram clothing of Hajj is a signifier of equality : all pilgrims are presented as equals in the eyes of God .
#Text=The white clothing also symbolises purity , and the state of absolute devotion that the pilgrims are in .
